articles.author: Debora MacKenzie
articles.title: How badly prepared is the world for a coronavirus pandemic?
articles.description: Multiple outbreaks of the covid-19 virus worldwide have led to countries stepping up their responses, but the virus may already be spreading in the US

articles.author: Debora MacKenzie
articles.title: We were warned – so why couldn’t we prevent the coronavirus outbreak?
articles.description: SARS and MERS gave us ample warning of the risk of new coronaviruses, but we failed to set up sufficient defences against covid-19 and other infections

articles.author: Adam Vaughan
articles.title: China has shut all of its wild animal markets – it was long overdue
articles.description: In an attempt to stem the spread of coronavirus, China has shut its wildlife markets for good. It is a welcome move, says Adam Vaughan

articles.author: Jessica Hamzelou
articles.title: Coronavirus: Concerns as UK delays release of new case locations
articles.description: The UK’s Department of Health and Social Care’s plan to report the locations of new cases of covid-19 only once a week may lead to more panic
articles.content:
By Jessica Hamzelou
The UK has set up coronavirus testing areas at hospitals
James Veysey/Shutterstock
The full details of new coronavirus infections in the UK will now only be released once a week. While the number of new cases will be published on a dail… [+2141 chars]

articles.title: Our fight against climate change could help us rein in coronavirus too
articles.description: The world's response to the growing covid-19 outbreak has surprising parallels with efforts to limit global warming, including transferable lessons
articles.content:
Frederic J Brown/AFP/Getty Images
WE ARE facing a global emergency, and politicians who appear to not believe in science are putting us all at risk.
That this statement applies equally to coronavirus and climate change says something about the era in which … [+357 chars]
